reviewText: I thought I was buying a different season from the one I bought in the shops in Australia (which was marked Season 2!) and it turned out to be the exact same story. Something is a bit wrong with the system when Season 1 in the States in season 2 in Australia?? My son who was eagerly awaiting his new Ninjago DVD was very disappointed to find out it was the same as the one he already had.Is there a whole season of the Boneheads (skeleton characters) or just the one 45min episode with the Boneheads and Lord Garmodon??

reviewText: I have a 5 and 7 year old who love this show! As a mother of two young boys, I am frequently stuck watching bad children's TV shows, like the Power Rangers.  If anyone is familiar with the Power Ranger Series, it is poorly acted and the story line is simplistic and boring for anyone over the age of 9??  So, when you run into a children's show that is fun to watch as an adult, it is a bonus!  So I like this DVD for a couple of reasons, the animation is very good, the  story line is funny and entertaining AND I get a break from the Power Rangers!!  :)  As a parent, it becomes more and more difficult to find family friendly and age appropriate shows for young kids.  Ninjago fits the bill perfectly!The Lego Clutch Powers is pretty entertaining as well so if your kids love LEGOs like mine, this is also a good movie to have in the family library!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We watch Ninjago on Cartoon Network and we all love it.  We were not able to see the episodes in season 1 so I downloaded it on my kindle fire and watched.  It is great treat for the kids when they can sit and watch it.  The whole family loves Ninjago.  The kids have some of the Lego pieces and copy the show while playing - it is cute to see the 3 year old singing the theme song and spinning the spinners (or him self) saying "Ninjagoooooooo".  Very cute to watch and enjoy.

reviewText: Ninjago Season 1 (Which is NOT this one. This is actually Season 2) had a great story. It had a classic ninja japanese fantasy vibe going. Then this season happened. I can't tell you how terrible it is without spoiling it. So if you're actually interested in seeing it, don't read on. If you actually buy it, though, don't say I didn't warn you.[SPOILERS]So season 1 was all fantasy-y. Season 2 is about snakes. And the fantasy part of it is ruined. Cole's father is a dancer, Nya drives Mechs, Jay's last name is "Walker," Jay turns out to be a robot, the "legendary" green ninja is a candy-obsessed 10-year-old, and they all go to live on a jet-powered boat with a supercomputer. In 2 seasons, it's gone from a great, promising fantasy epic to a childish robot story with out-of-place ninjas.
summary: Started as a great story, got ruined.

reviewText: Lego movie's and shows are hit or miss due to the fact that they are usually generated towards children MORE than adults, which is fine in a sense as well as expected, however, adults do enjoy such things too, especially if we're going to watch them with our kids, nieces, or nephews, etc. or even by ourselves. I thought that Lego Batman was pretty good, Lego Star Wars was OK, mostly forgettable, and the Lego Movie was VERY disappointing to say the least. Lego Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu: Season One however is shockingly amazing! Absolutely fun and a pleasure and feast of the eyes to look at, it is such a dog gone good show, I was SHOCKED, it looked like it was going to probably be bad to me, but needless to say I fell in love with it and was sad when the DVD was over, I cannot wait to watch season two and three, I just hope that they'll be just as good, they should do a Lego Batman and Star Wars TV show too!Lego Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu: Season One ***** out of *****Violent Content: 2/10 - Action Violence Involving Lego's.
summary: The greatest Lego movie or TV show I have EVER seen!
Title: N/A
